titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Billy Cunningham photographs V1990.055
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Patricia Glowinski
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-28T16:07-0500

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Billy Cunningham photographs consists of one photographic sheet containing two black-and-white portraits of Billy Cunningham in uniform for the Philadelphia 76ers, circa 1975.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Billy Cunningham was born in Brooklyn on June 3, 1943. He graduated from Erasmus Hall High School in Brooklyn and then attended the University of North Carolina at which he also played basketball. Cunningham went on to play professional basketball for the Philadelphia 76ers from 1965 to 1972 and then again from 1974 to 1976. He served as head coach of the 76ers from 1977 to 1985. Cunningham's nickname, "Kangaroo Kid," referred to his rebounding ability. He was inducted into the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame (as a player) in 1986.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Reproduction rights for the photographs have not been evaluated. For information on securing rights to publish or reproduce, please see the Brooklyn Historical Society Reproduction Rights Policy.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition for this collection are unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1990.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: Item level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library. Please consult library staff for more information.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Billy Cunningham photographs, V1990.055, Box number, Object ID number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Fully processed to the item level.
